law.catch_line: Enforcement of rights by bond holder or trustee of trust indenture.
law.text: Any holder of bonds issued under KRS 353.750 to 353.776 and the trustee under any trust indenture, except to the extent that rights may be restricted by the trust indenture, may, either at law or in equity, by suit, action, mandamus, or other proceedings, protect and enforce any and all rights arising under the laws of this Commonwealth, a trust indenture, or a proceeding authorizing the issuance of bonds; and may enforce and compel the performance of duties required under KRS 353.750 to 353.776, including the fixing, charging, and collecting of rents.
law.history: Created 2005 Ky. Acts ch. 155, sec. 8, effective June 20, 2005.
